summary: the world health organization revised the international health regulations to include risk communication as one of the core capacity areas. in 2006, the u.s. centers for disease control and prevention began collaborating with China to enhance China’s risk communication capacity to address gaps in the SARS communication response. electronic supplementary material available to authorized users. additional files Additional file 1: (14.3KB, docx) China Risk Comms Table 1 Pre event results 2017.docx (DOCX 14 kb) Additional file 2: (15.4KB, docx) China Risk Comms Table 2 Event results 2017.docx (DOCX 15 kb) Additional file 3: (14.5KB, docx) China Risk Communication capacity then and now comparison Table 08312017.docx (DOCX 16 kb) Additional
